There are $n$ rooms connected by $m$ doors. Each door between rooms $i$ and $j$ has a value $c_{ij}$ which represents the mood boost gained by moving from room $i$ to room $j$.  

Determine the minimum number of rooms that must be visited in a cycle to achieve an infinite mood boost. If no such cycle exists, output 0.

A cycle is a sequence of rooms where the last room connects back to the first.  Rooms can be visited multiple times within a cycle.

You are given a graph with nodes representing rooms and edges representing doors. Each door has a value associated with it.  Determine the minimum number of rooms that must be visited in a cycle to continuously increase a value. If no such cycle exists, output 0.
